title: [$250] Enable safe usage of Array.prototype.toSorted across our app

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from this proposal ### Background: Our app already runs on Hermes, which is the default JavaScript engine for React Native on Android and is also used on iOS builds. While Array.prototype.toSorted is a modern ECMAScript method supported in V8 (Chrome) and JavaScriptCore (Safari), it is not yet available in Hermes. Developers want to safely use toSorted in the codebase. Without consistent cross-platform support, adopting this feature introduces risk of crashes and runtime errors in production. ### Problem: When Array.prototype.toSorted is called in Hermes, it throws an error because the method is not implemented, which prevents us from safely using it in our codebase. ### Solution: We will polyfill Array.prototype.toSorted to enable consistent usage across platforms. Implementation steps: 1. Add the array.prototype.tosorted dependency to package.json. 1. Import the package in src/setup/index.ts and invoke its shim() function to define the polyfill globally. 1. Create a new file src/types/array.prototype.tosorted.d.ts to provide TypeScript type declarations for the functions exported by the package. 1. Validate that the app runs without errors across all supported platforms. This solution allows us to safely use toSorted across our app, ensuring modern JavaScript features can be used confidently in a cross-platform environment

  • Upwork Job ID: 1970780473154053280

Click on the forward or back arrow a few times ## Expected Result: When the video is played in full screen, the sound will stop playing after navigating through the existing attachments. ## Actual Result: When the video is played in full screen, the sound continues to play after switching between existing attachments. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7e9d6c1d-ef5a-480a-8194-560f20d96a74 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.17-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @carlosmiceli **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Quality](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1758662976944489) ## Action Performed: 1. Log in using an account that has a significant amount of existing chat history and reports 2. Reload the page 3. Hover on a user’s avatar in the LHN → tooltip appears as expected 4. Scroll down the LHN 5. Hover on another user’s avatar → no tooltip appears 6. Scroll back up or continue scrolling → hover states continue failing 7. Refresh the page → hover works again until further scrolling ## Expected Result: Tooltip bubbles should always display on hover, regardless of scroll position or page state. ## Actual Result: Tooltip bubbles stop appearing after scrolling in the LHN, Behavior is inconsistent and unpredictable. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
